rule.name: js/log-injection
rule.full_description: Building log entries from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of forged log entries by a malicious user.

message.text: Log entry depends on a user-provided value.

rule.name: js/http-to-file-access
rule.full_description: Writing network data directly to the file system allows arbitrary file upload and might indicate a backdoor.

message.text: Write to file system depends on Untrusted data.

rule.name: js/http-to-file-access
rule.full_description: Writing network data directly to the file system allows arbitrary file upload and might indicate a backdoor.

message.text: Write to file system depends on Untrusted data.

rule.name: js/file-system-race
rule.full_description: Separately checking the state of a file before operating on it may allow an attacker to modify the file between the two operations.

message.text: The file may have changed since it was checked.

rule.name: js/user-controlled-bypass
rule.full_description: Conditions that the user controls are not suited for making security-related decisions.

message.text: This condition guards a sensitive action, but a user-provided value controls it.

rule.name: js/regex/missing-regexp-anchor
rule.full_description: Regular expressions without anchors can be vulnerable to bypassing.

message.text: When this is used as a regular expression on a URL, it may match anywhere, and arbitrary hosts may come before or after it.

rule.name: js/password-in-configuration-file
rule.full_description: Storing unencrypted passwords in configuration files is unsafe.
rule.help:
# Password in configuration file
Storing a plaintext password in a configuration file allows anyone who can read the file to access the password-protected resources. Therefore it is a common attack vector.


## Recommendation
Passwords stored in configuration files should always be encrypted.


## References
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-256](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/256.html).
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-260](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/260.html).
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-313](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/313.html).
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-522](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/522.html).

message.text: Hard-coded password 'private' in configuration file.
